tit.e: Enoki Pass (Kyoto Prefecture and Hyogo Prefecture)
Enoki Pass (Kyoto Prefecture and Hyogo Prefecture)

sen.j: 榎峠（えのきとうげ）は、兵庫県丹波市と京都府福知山市との境にある峠。
sen.e: It is a pass on the border between Tanba City (Hyogo Prefecture) and Fukuchiyama City (Kyoto Prefecture).
It is a pass on the border between Tanba City, Hyogo Prefecture and Fukuchiyama City, Kyoto Prefecture.
It is a pass on the border between Tanba City, Hyogo Prefecture and Fukuchiyama City, Kyoto Prefecture.
It has an elevation of 270 meters.
It is at an altitude of 270 meters.
It is at an altitude of 270 meters.

sen.j: 国道429号が通っているが、すれ違い不能の狭路と見通しの悪いつづら折れのため通行はきわめて困難である。
sen.e: The traffic is very difficult as National Route 429 in the pass is impassably narrow and winding with bad visibility.
National Route 429 running through the pass is blind winding road which is so narrow that vehicles hardly go by each other and that makes the traffic extremely difficult to go through.
National Route 429 running through the pass is blind winding road which is so narrow that vehicles hardly go by each other and that makes the traffic extremely difficult to go through.

sen.j: 地元住民の車は榎峠よりも、比較的走行が容易な京都府道・兵庫県道109号福知山山南線の穴裏峠を越えることが多い。
sen.e: Local people tend to cross over Anaura Pass on Kyoto and Hyogo Prefecutural Road 109 Fukuchiyama Sannan Line which is easier to drive.
Local people tend to cross over Anaura Pass on Kyoto and Hyogo Prefectural Road 109 Fukuchiyama Sannan Line which is relatively easier to drive.
Local people tend to cross over Anaura Pass on Kyoto and Hyogo Prefectural Road 109 Fukuchiyama Sannan Line which is relatively easier to drive.

sen.j: 峠への登り口には「大型車通行困難」の標識があり、大型車の通行は事実上不可能である。
sen.e: There is a road sign saying "Driving here in a large-sized vehicle is difficult", but large-sized vehicles practically cannot drive the pass.
As a road sign saying 'Hardly Passable by Large Vehicles' is placed at the approach of the pass, large-sized vehicles practically cannot drive the pass.
As a road sign saying 'Hardly Passable by Large Vehicles' is placed at the approach of the pass, large-sized vehicles practically cannot drive the pass.
